members.name: setFilter
members.comment: Applies the given Predicate object to this FilteredRowSet object. The filter applies controls both to inbound and outbound views, constraining which rows are visible and which rows can be manipulated. A new Predicate object may be set at any time. This has the effect of changing constraints on the RowSet object's data. In addition, modifying the filter at runtime presents issues whereby multiple components may be operating on one FilteredRowSet object. Application developers must take responsibility for managing multiple handles to FilteredRowSet objects when their underling Predicate objects change.

param: p - a Predicate object defining the filter for this FilteredRowSet object. Setting a null value will clear the predicate, allowing all rows to become visible.
throws: SQLException - if an error occurs when setting the Predicate object

members.name: getFilter
members.comment: Retrieves the active filter for this FilteredRowSet object.

return: p the Predicate for this FilteredRowSet object; null if no filter has been set.
